alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 1:53PM AKST until February 25 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low with embedded waves will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday. Dry snow will spread from north to south across the panhandle. The snow will largely fall in two separate waves. A first, and weaker, wave will move through during Thursday night and early Friday morning. A brief lull may be possible Friday morning for some locations before a much stronger wave moves into the panhandle, bringing with it substantially more snow. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for parts of the northern and central inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening through early Saturday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 17 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Yakutat. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to reduced visibility and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall Thursday then greatest rates expected Friday evening with the second wave.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
